titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Elijah Jones and William Norman, Indictment
CWG9042

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Todd Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
against } Indictment April Term 1863
Ellijah Jones
William Norman

The Grand Jury of Todd County in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Elijah L Jones and William Norman of the offense of unlawfully carrying away property committed as follows viz

The said Elijah Jones and William Norman on the 10th day of October 1862 in the County aforesaid willfully and unlawfully went with felonious intent took from the House and possession of Noel Stinnett and carried away one Gun the property of said Stinnett and of the value of oneTen Dollars, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

W T Kennedy foreman
Grand Jury
E P Campbell attorney for the Commonwealth

Information by
Leander Stinnett
Nicholas Lacy
Dr J N Bartlett

A Copy
Attest
Ben T Perkins C. T. C. C.
